alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Windsor County through 1245 PM EDT... At 1215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartland, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Woodstock Village, Windsor, Hartland, Quechee, Hartford, Pomfret, West Windsor, Queechee State Park, Taftsville, North Hartland Dam Recreation Area, West Woodstock and North Hartland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 near mile marker 1. Interstate 91 between mile markers 54 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
